geninfo.para: This TSI applies to all vehicles with hydraulic brakes.
Vehicles with hydraulic brakes have two completely separate hydraulic systems that consist of:

item.para: Hydraulic pump (power steering) that provides fluid to the Hydro-max portion of the braking system to give power assist to the master cylinder that pressurizes the brakes.
The hydraulic brake system that includes the master cylinder and wheel end cylinders.

geninfo.para: The hydraulic pump and hydro-max booster operate on a fluid that is totally different from the fluid used in the hydraulic brake system. THE FLUIDS ARE NOT COMPATIBLE.

item.para: The hydraulic pump and hydro-max booster operate on POWER STEERING FLUID.
The hydraulic brake system operates on BRAKE FLUID.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: Introduction of fluids other than brake fluid in the master cylinder will result in the swelling and deterioration of rubber parts, leading to reduced brake performance and eventual failure of the brake system. Brake failure might result in personal injury.
A Caution label has been added to the master cylinder (in addition to embossed wording in the master cylinder reservoir cover) noting that the brake system uses only brake fluid.
To avoid putting the wrong fluid in the master cylinder (contaminating the system), the following precautions should be followed:

item.para: Use only fluids specified for each system. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Make sure that fluids are properly identified. Store only in the original containers and carefully check the label before using.
Power steering fluid only to the hydraulic pump reservoir. NOT THE MASTER CYLINDER.
Brake fluid ONLY to the master cylinder reservoir.
DISCARD - do not attempt to reuse - any fluid drained from either system.

svcproc.para: If the master cylinder is found to have non-compatible fluid, as indicated by swollen rubber components ( Figure 1), perform the following:

step1.para: Remove master cylinder and brake calipers.
Clean and rebuild master cylinder using new parts per International service instructions.
Replace all rubber brake line hoses.
Clean and rebuild brake calipers using new parts per International service instructions.
Optional: Replace all rubber brake line hoses, master cylinder and brake calipers with new units.

warning.para: Failure to completely purge the system of contaminated fluid and replace all contaminated rubber components will impair brake performance and possibly lead to brake failure resulting in personal injury.

note.para: Contaminated brake fluid is a maintenance error and is not covered by warranty.
